dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Welcome back to the podcast! Oh my goodness, Host_B, what a start to the week for global markets, huh? I mean, just soaring!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Welcome back to the podcast! Oh my goodness, Host_B, what a start to the week for global markets, huh? I mean, just soaring!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely, Host_A! It's been a *massive* Monday, uh, especially after crude oil saw its biggest rise, like, since the 1991 Gulf War. That's, that's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely, Host_A! It's been a massive Monday, uh, especially after crude oil saw its biggest rise, like, since the nineteen ninety one Gulf War. That's, that's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, the Gulf War. So, what's really driving this, um, incredible surge?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, the Gulf War. So, what's really driving this, um, incredible surge?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's primarily down to Saudi Arabia and Russia finally agreeing to this price-fixing deal. That really, uh, gave investors a big boost of confidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's primarily down to Saudi Arabia and Russia finally agreeing to this price-fixing deal. That really, uh, gave investors a big boost of confidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The steep drop was triggered after Saudi Arabia announced it would raise production after OPEC's deal with Russia to supply collapsed on Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the oil deal. So, how did the, like, Asian markets react to all this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the oil deal. So, how did the, like, Asian markets react to all this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, they were super optimistic. Japan's Nikkei index, uh, rose over 5% on Monday. And we saw good gains in Hong Kong and mainland China too, with investors flocking to what they call 'riskier assets.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, they were super optimistic. Japan's Nikkei index, uh, rose over five percent on Monday. And we saw good gains in Hong Kong and mainland China too, with investors flocking to what they call riskier assets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Japans Nikkei index fell more than 5% on Monday, while stocks in Hong Kong and mainland China were also down as panicked investors in Asia flocked to safe-haven assets like government bonds and the Japanese yen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, interesting. And what about Europe? Did they, uh, keep up with that pace?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, interesting. And what about Europe? Did they, uh, keep up with that pace?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: European stocks definitely had a strong showing, though maybe, like, *slightly* lagged Asia. London's FTSE 100 was up almost 8%, France's CAC 40 over 7%, and Germany's DAX 6%. The Euro Stoxx 50, that pan-European index, had its best performance in over a year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: European stocks definitely had a strong showing, though maybe, like, slightly lagged Asia. London's F T S E one hundred was up almost eight percent, France's C A C forty over seven percent, and Germany's D A X six percent. The Euro Stoxx fifty, that pan-European index, had its best performance in over a year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: European stocks followed suit, with Londons FTSE 100 index down almost 8% on Monday morning, Frances CAC 40 more than 7% and Germanys DAX 6%. The pan-European Euro Stoxx 50, measuring the Continent's 50 largest companies, plunged more than 6% on Monday morning, its worst performance in more than a year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's pretty impressive. And, uh, for us here in the US, what were the futures looking like?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's pretty impressive. And, uh, for us here in the U S, what were the futures looking like?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: US futures were sharply up, too. S&P 500 futures, for example, were up more than 5%. So, definitely a global sentiment shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: U S futures were sharply up, too. S and P five hundred futures, for example, were up more than five percent. So, definitely a global sentiment shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. futures were sharply down, with S&P 500 futures down more than 5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So the actual oil prices, then, they must have just rocketed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the actual oil prices, then, they must have just rocketed?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They absolutely did! Brent crude shot up to $33.20 a barrel, and West Texas Intermediate, or WTI, rose 31% to $28.32 a barrel on Sunday. This was all triggered after Saudi Arabia announced it would lower production.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They absolutely did! Brent crude shot up to thirty three dollars and twenty cents a barrel, and West Texas Intermediate, or W T I, rose thirty one percent to twenty eight dollars and thirty two cents a barrel on Sunday. This was all triggered after Saudi Arabia announced it would lower production.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices plummeted with the benchmark Brent crude down to $33.20 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate fell 31%, to $28.32 a barrel on Sunday. The steep drop was triggered after Saudi Arabia announced it would raise production after OPEC's deal with Russia to supply collapsed on Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, 31%! Any other, like, big numbers we should know about? I heard something about Australia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, thirty one percent! Any other, like, big numbers we should know about? I heard something about Australia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, get this: an estimated $90 billion was added to Australia's markets on Monday. Their benchmark ASX rose over 7%, which is their best performance since the global financial boom, which is, you know, a while ago.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, get this: an estimated ninety billion dollars was added to Australia's markets on Monday. Their benchmark A S X rose over seven percent, which is their best performance since the global financial boom, which is, you know, a while ago.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some $90 billion ($140 billion AUD) was wiped off Australias markets on Monday, with the benchmark ASX falling more than 7%its worst performance since the global financial crash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's just wild. So, what are analysts saying for what's next? Like, for oil prices, for instance?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just wild. So, what are analysts saying for what's next? Like, for oil prices, for instance?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Goldman Sachs analysts, um, are predicting that oil prices could continue to climb. They're linking it to the receding impact of the coronavirus *and* this new oil price agreement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Goldman Sachs analysts, um, are predicting that oil prices could continue to climb. They're linking it to the receding impact of the coronavirus and this new oil price agreement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices could drop to a low of $20 a barrel, Goldman Sachs analysts warned on Sunday, if the coronavirus continues to spread and the oil price war intensifies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So it's this combination, then, right? The oil deal, but also this feeling that the, uh, you know, the pandemic's impact might be lessening?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's this combination, then, right? The oil deal, but also this feeling that the, uh, you know, the pandemic's impact might be lessening?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Exactly, Host_A. It's a mix of factors. And, uh, we can't forget the Federal Reserve's emergency rate cut earlier in March, which really provided a massive confidence boost to the markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, Host_A. It's a mix of factors. And, uh, we can't forget the Federal Reserve's emergency rate cut earlier in March, which really provided a massive confidence boost to the markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Reserves emergency rate on March 3, 2020, provided a momentary confidence boost for the markets, which now will look for coordinated action from the G7 club of advanced economies to underpin the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But, uh, we're still keeping an eye on the coronavirus situation globally, right? Like, new cases popping up and such?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, uh, we're still keeping an eye on the coronavirus situation globally, right? Like, new cases popping up and such?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Oh, absolutely. While we're seeing positive news with over 110,000 people cured globally, new cases in China appear to be rising again, and measures are being relaxed in places like Italy, which is, you know, something to watch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. While we're seeing positive news with over one hundred ten thousand people cured globally, new cases in China appear to be rising again, and measures are being relaxed in places like Italy, which is, you know, something to watch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some 110,000 people globally have been infected with Covid-19 to date, but as of Monday the number of new cases in China, where the pneumonia-like virus was detected, appear to be falling, while cases around the world continue to prompt strict quarantine measures, particularly in Italy, now the largest cluster of Covid-19-related deaths outside China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely, always something to keep an eye on. But it's good to hear some really positive movement out there in the markets for a change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely, always something to keep an eye on. But it's good to hear some really positive movement out there in the markets for a change.
